entry.summary: Set against the stark backdrops attainable only during blackwater dives, larval fish become strange, otherworldly specimens with glasslike bodies and translucent fins that billow outward. Their delicate, still-developing anatomies are the subjects of Steven Kovacsâ€™s underwater photos, which frame the young creatures at such precarious stages of life. Living in Palm Beach, Kovacs (previously) frequents the waters off the Florida coasts, although heâ€™s also recently explored areas near Kona, Hawaii. More

entry.title: In Graham Francioseâ€™s â€˜Morning Coffee Paintings,â€™ Dreamlike Watercolor Works Capture the Dayâ€™s Unmediated Emotion
entry.summary: Many days, artist and illustrator Graham Franciose sits down with watercolor, gouache, and a small sheet of cotton paper to paint a whimsical scene or surreal moment. A skateboarder carries a tree in a backpack, an anxious figure peeks through a colorful monster mask, and an oversized lion snarls at an approaching man. â€œI like to do these first thing in the morning when I am still not fully awake and start with a blank slate and no preconceived idea,â€ he tells Colossal.
